title: What Is the National Guard, and Who Controls It?
summary: The state-based military force is made up mainly of part-time soldiers and organized by state. It can be activated by the state governor or by the president.

title: Processing the Government Shutdown in a Divided America
summary: As the government shutdown entered its first full week, emotions across the country ranged from uneasy to unconcerned.

title: Groups Sue E.P.A. Over $7 Billion in ‘Solar for All’ Grants
summary: The lawsuit accused the Environmental Protection Agency of illegally revoking the money without congressional approval.

title: Bessent Taps Social Security Chief to Serve as C.E.O. of I.R.S.
summary: Frank Bisignano, who already leads the Social Security Administration, will also take on the day-to-day duties of the tax collector.

title: Supreme Court Rejects Appeal From Ghislaine Maxwell, Longtime Epstein Associate
summary: The onetime employee and friend of Jeffrey Epstein argued that a secret agreement between prosecutors and the multimillionaire financier invalidated her conviction.

title: Supreme Court Returns to Face Trump Tests of Presidential Power
summary: As the justices return to the bench Monday, the court will confront a series of cases central to the president’s agenda.

title: We Asked 50 Legal Experts About the Trump Presidency. They’re Very, Very Worried.
summary: Before the election, we surveyed the legal establishment about what a second Trump term could mean for the rule of law. A year later, they’re very, very worried.

title: Paramount Buys Bari Weiss’s Free Press, Starting a New Era at CBS News
summary: Bari Weiss, a founder of The Free Press, will become editor in chief of CBS News.

title: How Bari Weiss of The Free Press Won the Top Job at CBS News
summary: At The Free Press, she battled “wokeness” and buddied up with billionaires. Now she’s the editor in chief of CBS News.

title: We May Know Why Ernest Shackleton’s Endurance Really Sank
summary: The explorer’s journey to Antarctica was likely doomed before it began.

title: Trying to Survive Gaza’s War-Torn Present, and Hoping for a Future
summary: Two years of intense warfare in Gaza have left its people with a dismembered and disordered society. The destruction is vast and many Gazans have mental and physical wounds that could scar a generation.

title: Gaza Peace Talks Are Set to Take Place in Egypt
summary: Though significant issues remain to be hashed out between Israel and Hamas, some are saying that after two years of death and destruction, a breakthrough may be near.

title: Greta Thunberg Among Hundreds From Gaza Aid Flotilla Deported by Israel
summary: Israel intercepted the boats at sea and detained the participants for days before expelling them. Some of the activists say they were mistreated, which Israel denied.

title: Harvard Has Identified Another Problem: Its Own Students
summary: Many students don’t do the reading and don’t speak up in class, according to a report. Now, professors are trying to change a campus culture they say hurts achievement and stifles speech.

title: Lee Lozano Didn’t Speak to Other Women for 28 Years. What Did It Cost Her?
summary: When it came to using her life in her work, the artist Lee Lozano went about as far as a person can go.

title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Resigns
summary: Sébastien Lecornu’s departure ratcheted up pressure on President Emmanuel Macron to call snap parliamentary elections.

title: How Elon Musk Is Bringing Sexy A.I. Chatbots to the Mainstream
summary: In July, the billionaire’s A.I. company introduced two sexually explicit chatbots, pushing a new version of intimacy.

title: OpenAI Agrees to Use Computer Chips From AMD
summary: Weeks after a $100 billion agreement to use computer chips from Nvidia, OpenAI has signed a similar deal with a rival chipmaker.

title: Undersea Bacteria Feast on Methane. Can They Help Cool the Planet?
summary: They feast on bubbles of methane seeping out of the ocean floor. Could their appetites be harnessed to slow climate change?

title: Ukraine’s Secret Weapons Spending Faces Questions After Internal Review
summary: The government reviews show the country’s challenge as U.S. support wanes and Kyiv pivots to production from a domestic arms industry with a long history of corruption.

title: Russia Welcomes Trump’s Blessing of Proposal to Extend Caps on Nuclear Weapons
summary: President Trump said a Russian proposal to extend by one year the limits on long-range nuclear weapons sounded “like a good idea to me.”

title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine Is Awarded for Work on Immune Systems
summary: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi were awarded the prize for research showing how the body regulates its immune responses.

title: Nobel Prizes 2025: What to Know
summary: The awards are being announced this week.

title: In Ashes of Amazon Fight, Tensions Emerge in Huge Bet on N.Y.C. Housing
summary: Years ago, progressives defeated a plan to build headquarters for Amazon in Queens. Now a new kind of development is gaining their support.

title: Political Violence. Threats to Free Speech. A Disinformation Crisis. We’ve Been Here Before.
summary: To see a way out of our destructive spiral we should look to the innovation of the 1920s.

title: The New Right After Trump
summary: A conservative’s vision for MAGA beyond Trump.

title: President Trump and the Supreme Court
summary: Today, we look ahead at the potential consequences of the Supreme Court term that begins today.

title: Retrial in 1993 Buffalo Murder Case Ends With a Deadlocked Jury
summary: Brian Scott Lorenz’s conviction in the strangling of Deborah Meindl in a Buffalo suburb was overturned in 2023, but prosecutors had forged ahead with a new trial.

title: Chris Dreja, a Founding Member of the Yardbirds, Dies at 78
summary: A rhythm guitarist and bassist, he was a “rock” for a band whose fiery lead players, Eric Clapton, Jeff Beck and Jimmy Page, had no shortage of ego.

title: Fire Consumes Home Owned by a South Carolina State Judge
summary: Three people, who had to be rescued by kayak, were injured. The cause of the fire is under investigation.
